channel.title: Startup on Mainroad
channel.description: Recent content in Startup on Mainroad

item.title: Be Painkiller - For startup
item.description: The saying, “Don’t be an Ayurveda medicine, be a pain killer,” is a good analogy for the benefits of working quickly. Ayurveda medicine is often referred to as slow-acting and can take days or even weeks to produce results. Pain killers, on the other hand, are fast-acting and can provide relief from pain almost immediately. In the same way, working quickly can provide immediate results, while working slowly can take a long time to produce results.
